result.execSummary:
The defendant Kevin M. Barstad was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Kevin M. Barstad is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Kevin M. Barstad was found guilty of Child Abuse-Recklessly Cause Harm, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.03(3)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Corrected Judgment of Conviction After Revocation

records.addlTxt: from CL
Letter re: attendance in jail programs

Defendant, Kevin M. Barstad, in custody, appeared with Attorney Adam P Nero.  Prosecuting attorney Andrea Amidon Nodolf.  Defendant in custody.  Kim Silvius - Clerk
(4:22)  MULTIPLE CASES HEARD.
State - 13CF281 - sent correspondence to P.H. did not receive any feedback - 15CF28 - got a hold C.L. filed a written statement -- argues sentence
State - argues for concurrent sentences - credit 198 days 15CF28  credit 293 days - Prison 2 1/2 IC 3 yr es - 13CF281 - prison 1 yr and 2 yrs - civil judgment for $500 to P.H. for unpaid rest.

Nero - argues sentencing - requests Dunn Co jail sentence - order consecutive time rather then prison sentence
Court questions Nero
Nero offers Exh 1 - programs certificates - recd
State - rebuttal there is no treatment
Deft - addresses sentence - willing to do in or out patient treatment at Arbor Place
Court questions deft

COURT:
13CF281 - Prison 5 yrs; 2 yr IC and 3 yrs ES - concurrent to 15CF28
credit 293 days
AODA assessment and treatment 

15CF28 - Prison 2 yrs; 1 yrs IC and 1 yrs ES - concurrent to 13CF281
credit 198 days

cannot vote - no firearms
eligible for challenge incarceration & earned release
civil judgment for rest. & costs
any bonds would apply to judgment

Defendant, Kevin M. Barstad with Attorney Adam P Nero appeared.  Prosecuting attorney Andrea Amidon Nodolf.  Hanna Neuberg - Clerk 3:09 pm
Nero - DE rec'd warrant and order 
State - revoked on 13CF281 is Br 2 matter - sentencing packet go over both matters - victims have not been given notice and not complied with - requesting matter to be continued
Nero - argues that victim rights not being complied with - does not object to continuance - has no objection to Br 2 sentencing

COURT - does not have objection for Br 2 sentencing on both matters - 13CF281 & 15CF28 set for sentencing in Br 2 - Br 1 has no objection for Br 2 doing sentencing

  Sentencing hearing on revocation scheduled for December 13, 2016 at 04:15 pm.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on November 22, 2016 at 03:00 pm.
Does not plan to seek post conviction relief.

Defendant, Kevin M. Barstad with Attorney Donald J. Schwab appeared.  Prosecuting attorney .  Janell Evan - Clerk.  8:33 am  
Agreement:  plead to ct 1 of second amended infor, dismiss repeater enhancer
w/held, 18 mo prob, $518 cc

Def - waives rights, pleads guilty to ct 1 - 2nd amended information w/ penalty enhancer stricken
parties stip to facts

COURT:  finds waives vol, finds suff facts, finds def guilty - ct. 1 -  2nd amended information - STRIKE penalty enhancer
w/held sentence, 18 mo probation concurrent w/present probation,  no contact with W.A.L. - DOB 1/20/13, continue working toward GED
DNA sample if required, participate in any programming required by PO
62 days credit if revoked
$268 cc, plus $250 DNA chg- 60 dtp or pay plan
Dismiss ct 2
2nd Amended Information
Plaintiff's MIL
Amended
